main event: A witness observed a white light in the sky for about 20 minutes on October 16, 1964 in Fairborn, Ohio.
interesting points: The object appeared to be slightly larger than the full moon and was dimmer in brightness.
The object moved through and behind cirrus-type clouds at times, and was also obscured by trees.
The object made a straight, upward path and made no sound.
The witness could not cover the object with a match stick, indicating it was quite large in the sky.
The witness described the object as a 'round, white, moving construct'.
result: Astronomical (V1138) - Likely a meteor or satellite
sighted object: a single white light in the sky
